MichelleShi\_ left at 10:35 (Ping timeout: 268 seconds

tmortagne joined #xwiki at 10:46  
anamarias - (10:52): why is this not good: Constructor Calls Overridable Method ?  
anamarias - (10:52): http://nemo.sonarsource.org/drilldown/violations/207147?rule=pmd%3AConstructorCallsOverridableMethod#  
tmortagne - (10:58): anamarias: not even sure what is it :)  
tmortagne - (10:58): do you have an example ?  
anamarias left at 10:59 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
anamarias joined #xwiki at 10:59  
tmortagne - (11:02): anamarias: you can find a explanation on http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod\_mbox/commons-issues/200903.mbox/%3C1942491292.1237152770544.JavaMail.jira@brutus%3E  
tmortagne - (11:02): but i'm not sure i agree with that  
tmortagne - (11:03): anamarias: extract: "The constructor SequencedHashMap(Map) calls the public non-final method putAll(). This is likely to cause problems if the class is ever extended."  
tmortagne - (11:04): since we sometime make this on purpose to have a "configurable" behavior of the constructor  
tmortagne - (11:05): anamarias: note that our checkstyle doe snot care about that and i don't agree with several other things tagged as error by sonar  
anamarias - (11:05): tmortagne: that's what I was thinking, what if you DO want to call the overridden method from the constructor for the new classes  
anamarias - (11:05): ok, i see  
anamarias - (11:16): in what module is located XWiki/WikiMacroParameterClass.xml in SVN? I couldn't find in xwiki-applications nor web...  
tmortagne - (11:16): anamarias: it's generated  
tmortagne - (11:17): like it should for a xclass  
tmortagne - (11:17): not sure where is the java code to generate it but i guess it's either xwiki-core or wiki macro bridge module  
anamarias - (11:18): hmm, generated from where? I mean, If I want to add an extra property to it, where would I do that?  
anamarias - (11:18): ok  
anamarias - (11:24): tmortagne: is this it: DefaultWikiMacroInitializer#installOrUpgradeWikiMacroClasses()?  
anamarias - (11:24): http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-core/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/internal/DefaultWikiMacroInitializer.java  
tmortagne - (11:25): looks like it yes  
anamarias - (11:26): why is this class generated from Java, and not an xml representing the document instead?  
tmortagne - (11:27): anamarias: wiki macro should works even when you don't import anything  
tmortagne - (11:27): most of the important classes are supposed to be generated  
tmortagne - (11:27): also it's not only generate it's also upgrade of the class  
tmortagne - (11:28): sinc ethe java code need some specific format it should make sure itself it's there  
tmortagne - (11:28): othwise you always have issues  
tmortagne - (11:29): for example here you are about to add new things it it, that mean if it was a document toimport nothing would works after an upgrade because the class is not right  
anamarias - (11:30): thanks, more clear now  
tmortagne - (11:32): anamarias: you'r welcome  
silviar left at 12:17 (Read error: Connection reset by peer

anamarias left at 12:42 (Quit: anamarias

silviar joined #xwiki at 13:20

bblfish - (13:33): hello  
nickless joined #xwiki at 13:35  
plunden left #xwiki at 13:42  
arkub joined #xwiki at 13:53  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 13:59  
CalebJamesDeLisl joined #xwiki at 14:00  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 14:04  
florinciu left at 14:30 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
lucaa left #xwiki at 14:39  
anamarias - (14:39): tmortagne: should  #set($paramValue = $context.macro.params.get($paramName)) return the default value if no value is provided by the user or not?  
tmortagne - (14:41): anamarias: that's the point of introducing default values defined at wiki macro descriptor level i think  
anamarias - (14:42): so for the java ones that's the behavior now?  
anamarias - (14:43): because for the wiki ones, the wysiwyg fields are populated with the default value  
mflorea - (14:43): tmortagne: anamarias discovered an interesting case. If you declare a parameter as required and specify a default value for it then you get an exception when you insert that macro with the wysiwyg because the parameter has no value (the editor doesn't send the default value) (I know, if it has a default value then it shouldn't be required, but if we consider the default value to be used to help the user input a value for the parameter, this i  
anamarias - (14:43): however $context.macro.params.get($paramName)) does not return the default value  
tmortagne - (14:44): mflorea: as you said, if user doe snotprovide a value for a required parameter i don't see why i should work  
tmortagne - (14:45): the fact that the specified default value is useless as nothing to do with that  
mflorea - (14:45): well, the user leaves the input as it is, fulled with the default value, but the editor doesn't send the default value  
tmortagne - (14:45): i think in this case the WYSIWYG should send the default value  
tmortagne - (14:46): mflorea: sure but as the user understand it he just did not want to change the value that is already here, the bug is at WYSIWYG level  
mflorea - (14:46): tmortagne: that's bad because this way when you edit a macro all the default value will be added to the wiki syntax  
mflorea - (14:46): I don't like it  
tmortagne - (14:46): that should support properly reuired parameter  
tmortagne - (14:46): mflorea: no  
tmortagne - (14:46): you don't understabnd  
tmortagne - (14:46): if not all default value  
tmortagne - (14:47): i'm saying WYSIWYG should properly support requred values  
tmortagne - (14:47): the WYSIWYG has this infromation  
mflorea - (14:47): it does, wdym?  
tmortagne - (14:47): so fir resuired value it should always send the value  
mflorea - (14:47): ok, I see  
tmortagne - (14:47): mflorea: it's part of the parameter descriptor api  
tmortagne - (14:47): i don't know if you send it to teh WYSIWYG but i guess you do  
mflorea - (14:47): got it, it's a bug  
mflorea - (14:48): anamarias: can you open a bug on the wysiwyg editor?  
anamarias - (14:49): mflorea sure  
mflorea - (14:49): thanks  
anamarias - (14:49): so the parameter should be sent, even when the default value is left as it was  
mflorea - (14:49): if the parameter is required  
mflorea - (14:50): otherwise no  
anamarias - (14:50): ok  
mflorea - (14:50): now, about the case when the parameter is not requried  
anamarias - (14:50): one other thing,  
anamarias - (14:50): $context.macro.params.parameterNames returns an empty list  
mflorea - (14:50): should the rendering fill the parameter value with the default value?  
anamarias - (14:51): if no value was provided for the parameters  
anamarias - (14:51): not even the ones with default values  
mflorea - (14:51): strange, looks like a bug  
tmortagne - (14:51): mflorea: that's a wiki macro only issue actiually  
tmortagne - (14:52): since java macros use java bean you already have this  
mflorea - (14:52): ok, then anamarias can provide a fix for it :)  
tmortagne - (14:52): the defutl value you get in the descriptor is generated by creating anew instance of the java bean and calling the getter for the parameter  
tmortagne - (14:53): so the rendering does not need to do anything  
mflorea - (14:53): I see  
anamarias - (14:53): mflorea: yup, so getValue should return the default value if value set is null  
mflorea - (14:53): anamarias: yes  
anamarias - (14:53): wiki macro descriptor do no use the bean  
anamarias - (14:53): \*descriptors  
tmortagne - (14:53): anamarias: that's why i said it's a wiki macro issue only and not rendering  
anamarias - (14:54): but SHOULD the wiki macros use java beans too?  
tmortagne - (14:54): anamarias: yes it will but it's not possible yet  
tmortagne - (14:55): because you need dynamic bean descriptor  
tmortagne - (14:55): taht need to be added to xwiki-properties  
tmortagne - (14:55): i have a jira issue for it  
tmortagne - (14:55): but it's not trivial  
anamarias - (14:55): hmm i see  
tmortagne - (14:55): so for now not needed just for the default value support  
tmortagne - (14:56): it will be needed for parameter types support  
anamarias - (14:56): we need parameter types support next  
tmortagne - (14:56): see http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-4666  
anamarias - (14:57): the gadget macros need types badly  
tmortagne - (14:57): is it really than much critical ?  
tmortagne - (14:58): it's a nice to have for wiki macro IMO  
anamarias - (14:58): well, they really need the enum type  
anamarias - (14:58): to display a select for them  
tmortagne - (14:58): for example if you do yourmacro in groovy and other scripting language like jython i thinkyou don't really care about the varibles type, they are automatically converted when needed  
tmortagne - (14:59): anamarias: ok  
anamarias - (14:59): you can't expect the user to guess the required set of values  
tmortagne - (14:59): note that a complex macro made by us should always be in JAVA IMO  
tmortagne - (14:59): wiki macros are user tools  
anamarias - (15:00): i need to generate(import) macros from gadgets  
mflorea - (15:00): the problem is that you can't import gadget as java macros  
anamarias - (15:00): in the interface you provide a gadget XML and a XWiki macro should be the result  
mflorea - (15:01): you need to save them as objects, ie to persist them  
anamarias - (15:01): is it possible to create a java macro like that? dinamically?  
tmortagne - (15:01): ok but in this case enum will not help much  
tmortagne - (15:01): it's not what you need  
tmortagne - (15:01): enum are statics  
anamarias - (15:01): i know :(  
anamarias - (15:02): you can't create them dinamically  
tmortagne - (15:02): what you need is http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Design/Propertiesdisplayers  
tmortagne - (15:02): which is not yet even supported by java macros  
anamarias - (15:02): i found some hacks though, but i don't think that's the way to do it :P  
mflorea - (15:02): anamarias: you can use a special class which extends list and is know by the editor  
tmortagne - (15:03): yes that's the only way to do it we have now  
mflorea - (15:03): so the editor handles it as an enum  
tmortagne - (15:03): but it can be endless for the editor  
anamarias - (15:03): what class is that?  
mflorea - (15:04): a class you make  
tmortagne - (15:04): anamarias: it does not exist, you have to define a java class for your use case and it has to be supported by the WYSIWYG  
mflorea - (15:04): exactly  
tmortagne - (15:04): in other words there is no generic way like described in http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Design/Propertiesdisplayers\*  
mflorea - (15:05): the editor looks for the parameter type and if it detects this class then it handles it as an enum  
anamarias - (15:05): i see  
mflorea - (15:07): although the editor needs to access the allowed values in a static way, hmm  
tmortagne - (15:07): mflorea: yes that's why it's endless you have to define one different class by usecase  
tmortagne - (15:08): and it's impossible to use that for "dynamic use cases"  
mflorea - (15:08): but i could use reflection  
tmortagne - (15:08): mflorea: you only have the class  
tmortagne - (15:08): sure you can use reflecion on the class but it's still all static datas  
mflorea - (15:09): can I access a static field using only the class?  
tmortagne - (15:09): mflorea: yes but well it's static :)  
mflorea - (15:09): yes, but we can agree to use a know name for the field, like "allowedValues"  
mflorea - (15:09): ah  
mflorea - (15:09): :)  
mflorea - (15:10): then anamarias can't fill the list :)  
tmortagne - (15:10): yep  
anamarias - (15:10): mflorea: http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-4946  
tmortagne - (15:10): it's kind of ok for java macro even a little hacky but there is nothing you can do for anamarias use case  
anamarias - (15:11): nooo :(  
sematicweboholic joined #xwiki at 15:11  
tmortagne - (15:12): in a general way macro/parameter descriptor manipulation should never depends on reflection or it's not generic enough  
mflorea - (15:13): yes  
tmortagne - (15:14): we should not even have MacroDescriptor#getParametersBeanClass(), i need to refactor that but it's not critical for now  
bblfish - (15:15): hello  
vmassol - (15:16): bblfish: I'm going to be otp in a few seconds. Please check the irc log for yeseterday night when I've tried to install your jars  
vmassol - (15:16): http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/IRC/  
bblfish - (15:16): ok  
bblfish - (15:18): what should I use instead of ScriptService ?  
bblfish - (15:22): vmassol: that's what I was told to use - did not know that you were using 2.2 on the test site  
bblfish left at 15:37 (Quit: ("http://bblfish.net/people/henry/card#me")  
hcross left #xwiki at 15:40  
bblfish joined #xwiki at 15:43  
bblfish - (15:43): back  
vmassol - (15:46): bblfish: yes myxwiki.org is on 2.2  
vmassol - (15:47): I guess we could upgrade it to 2.3M1 snapshot if we think it's stable enough  
bblfish - (15:47): btw, I think a really cool thing to do would be to make the user profiles have very short urls  
vmassol - (15:47): sdumitriu, tmortagne, jvelociter and co: wdyt?  
sdumitriu - (15:48): +1 from me  
tmortagne - (15:48): seems a bit dangerous but anyway that's the goal of myxwiki.org after all so +1 for me  
vmassol - (15:48): tmortagne: actually we should upgrade after you fix the big 2.2 bug  
tmortagne - (15:48): sure  
vmassol - (15:48): that would help for myxwiki anyway  
jvelociter - (15:48): well 2.3 M1 has the same bugs as 2.2  
vmassol - (15:49): jvelociter: not really  
jvelociter - (15:49): no ?  
jvelociter - (15:49): (I mean the bad bugs)  
vmassol - (15:49): there are about 10-20 issues fixed in between  
tmortagne - (15:49): jvelociter: yes but i don't plan tio fix it only in 2.2 branch :)  
vmassol - (15:49): :)  
jvelociter - (15:49): right  
jvelociter - (15:49): but that means upgrading to a snapshot  
vmassol - (15:49): yes  
jvelociter - (15:49): ok for me  
tmortagne - (15:49): yes  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 15:50  
vmassol - (15:50): ok so let's wait for thomas's bug fix (and if jerome's can be in, even better) and let's plan some upgrade tomorrow  
vmassol - (15:50): bblfish: this means 1 day delya to install your stuff  
vmassol - (15:50): s/delya/delay/  
vmassol - (15:50): is that ok?  
bblfish - (15:50): ok, no problem. I can improve the software inbetween  
bblfish - (15:51): but I have one thing that I think would be really useful, as I said, and that I think all your clients will really like  
arkub left at 15:51 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds  
bblfish - (15:51): and that is short account names  
vmassol - (15:51): bblfish: how do you imagine this?  
vmassol - (15:52): how do you recognize it's a profile page?  
bblfish - (15:52): so http://myxwiki.org/p/bblfish  
bblfish - (15:52): or  http://myxwiki.org/user/bblfish  
vmassol - (15:52): so this means it's installed in the ROOT webapp  
bblfish - (15:52): or even http://myxwiki.org/bblfish  
vmassol - (15:52): this won't work if someone is named bin  
bblfish - (15:52): yes, because then with 3 lines of html I can turn each user's profile into an OpenId  
vmassol - (15:52): or rest  
vmassol - (15:52): or xmlrpc  
bblfish - (15:52): heh  
vmassol - (15:53): or any url type we support  
vmassol - (15:53): (now or in the future)  
bblfish - (15:53): ok so: http://myxwiki.org/me/bblfish  
bblfish - (15:53): ?  
vmassol - (15:53): yes that's seems possible  
vmassol - (15:53): (still needs the webapp installed as ROOT but we can do that)  
sdumitriu - (15:54): vmassol: I'd really like to have shorturls by default  
bblfish - (15:54): I think that will make it very useful. So one problem with foaf  
vmassol - (15:54): sure make a proposal  
sdumitriu - (15:54): Since we fixed the class wizard it's possible to get rid of everything except /bin/  
bblfish - (15:54): +ssl is that some browsers (on cell phones especially) don't support client certs  
bblfish - (15:54): so OpenId is going to be around for some time  
vmassol - (15:55): sdumitriu: even bin/ can be removed, ie we consider bin if no other match but this means remiving struts in favor of our actions  
vmassol - (15:55): s/remiving/removing/  
sdumitriu - (15:56): Yes, but that doesn't work in Tomcat by default  
sdumitriu - (15:56): We need a servlet that can let filesystem resources pass  
vmassol - (15:57): hmmm  
vmassol - (15:57): unless we have  a very fast implementation for actions, no?  
sdumitriu - (15:57): Yes  
vmassol - (15:58): the best actually  
vmassol - (15:58): in term of perf  
vmassol - (15:58): is to let resources be handled by apache  
vmassol - (15:58): (and not tomcat)  
sdumitriu - (15:58): Yes  
sdumitriu - (15:58): But that's server config, we can't enforce it  
vmassol - (15:58): right  
sdumitriu - (15:59): And most people don't read installation instructions, and we've had enough problems with non-tomcat installs  
vmassol - (15:59): sure  
vmassol - (15:59): we need to offer something that works OOB  
vmassol - (15:59): + some perf guides for those who need more perfs  
bblfish - (15:59): yes, no problem for working out of the box  
bblfish - (15:59): but I think a demo where you show what is possible is good  
vmassol - (15:59): so yes the OOB solution should not be too slow  
vmassol - (15:59): so that it's acceptable  
bblfish - (16:00): and the OpenId is no problem if it is long OOB, just that it won't be useful I mean nobody is going to type http://myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/bblfish in a cell phone  
vmassol - (16:01): you'd use some bit.ly url instead ;)  
vmassol - (16:02): isn't there some short url service that allow for suffixes?  
vmassol - (16:02): (I think there are)  
bblfish - (16:03): yes, that's a solution of course. Just a bit ugly, and you are asking people to think of one extra step.  
bblfish - (16:03): anyway, that was a thought.  
arkub joined #xwiki at 16:04  
vmassol - (16:06): bblfish: fyi I'm working right now on introducing an new xwiki url module to cleanly handle urls  
vmassol - (16:06): this means that any url shceme will be abel to be implemented without affecting any other part of the xwiki code  
bblfish - (16:06): very nice :-)  
arkub left at 16:16 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds  
arkub joined #xwiki at 16:17  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:38): I seem to be stuck in the mud. For comments to require a captcha, the code which posts the comment has to call CaptchaVerifier. The code is in xwiki-core and I don't want the core to depend on xwiki-captcha. But I can't use a template because there is no way for users without edit right to save a document (to add the comment).  
bblfish - (16:39): the header of this irc chat should have a link to the logs  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:40): The only option I can think of is add an application which has programming rights. Which would mean modify XWiki.getCommentsClass to add code to XWiki.CommentsClass document and set author to XWiki.Admin  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:41): And that's pretty ugly.  
sdumitriu - (17:02): Better have a dependency in the core  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:05): I was just thinking that.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:06): I will make sure to put a big "just until we have modular actions" comment. Thanks for the feedback Sergiu.  
silviar left at 17:07 (Quit: Leaving.  
vmassol left at 17:14 (Quit: Leaving.  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 17:16  
bblfish - (17:20): vmassol: so did I understand it correctly that you will be upgrading incubator.myxwiki.org in the next few days?  
tmortagne - (17:28): bblfish: yes that's the plan, so that ScriptService works on myxwiki.org  
bblfish - (17:29): ok, great. I'll add OpenId support then, so that your web page automatically becomes an openid too  
prototypoholica joined #xwiki at 17:30  
flaviusolaru left at 17:31 (Quit: Leaving.  
sematicweboholic left at 17:31 (Ping timeout: 264 seconds  
florinciu left at 17:41 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
tmortagne - (17:57): CalebJamesDeLisl: is XAADMINISTRATION-113 compatible with 2.2 ?
